text: An enterprise application is:

answers.answer_text: The software that runs the navigation for the USS Enterprise
Any software that has been developed by a major organisation
A large software system designed to support a major aspect of an organisations operations
Any software that is used by a major enterprise

text: Deloitte research has identified a number of key approaches to attracting and retaining expert staff. Select the top three reasons that were identified.

answers.answer_text: Allow employers to have dinner with the boss
Be recognised as a good employer

text: Which of these should you be able to explain for the topic The IT Industry following the week 1 lecture? (Select all that apply)

answers.answer_text: The effects that has on organisations
Examples of IT-related jobs and careers
The kinds of changes that have taken place in IT and how it might change in the future

text: Which of the following is the greatest obstacle to the success of most major change projects.
Match the design approach with the most appropriate role of users.

answers.matching: Designing with the involvement of users

matching_list: Designing despite being interrupted by users
Designing whilst being paid by users
Designing with the involvement of users
Designing for the needs of users

text: Fill in the blank by selecting the one that is most correct, according to the reading (The different models of project teams in project management), In a matrix organisational structure, team members will _____________.

answers.answer_text: work in both functional and project-based roles
be involved in making science-fiction movie series
work in both project-based and program-based roles

text: According to the reading (The different models of project teams in project management), what remains common in building a project team?

answers.answer_text: The goal of successful project completion with an effective group of people.

text: According to the reading (The different models of project teams in project management), in the case that a project team is quite large, which of the following factors are true? (Select all that apply).

answers.answer_text: The project lead may manage the sub-teams themselves.
There is no proper team structure.
There may be sub-teams for functional pieces
For each sub-team there may be a lead who deals directly with the project lead.

text: The reading (Forming project teams – the right mix is key to success) referred to Tuckman's five stages, and this was then explained further in reading 4 (5 Stages of a Team Development Tuckman | Better Explained). One of the five stages is storming, where a team has problems. Which of the following are identified as ways of dealing with these problems? (Select all that apply).

answers.answer_text: Always give work to the person who is most capable
Fire anyone who is a troublemaker
Define tasks clearly within individuals domains
Only allocate work to people who are keen to do it

text: According to the reading (Team Building in Project Management), which of the following are major barriers to project teams development? (Select all that apply).
According to the reading (Critical success factors in project management. To fail or not to fail, that is the question!) what are some of the factors that substantially influence project success?

answers.answer_text: The change in the company environment.

text:
The reading (Information Technology and Business Alignment: Why it is Important) discusses the importance of ensuring the goals and objectives are expressed in a clear and coherent manner and suggest the SMART model be used to do this.

Which option below correctly identified what each letter in the SMART model stands for?

answers.answer_text: Scope, Measurable, Achievable, Risks, Time Bound
Specific, Management, Achievable, Risks, Time Bound
Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Realistic, Time Bound
Stakeholders, Measurable, Achievable, Risks, Time Bound

text: As per the reading (Information Technology and Business Alignment: Why it is Important) which of the following statements about IT Business alignment are true? (Select all that are applicable).

answers.answer_text: There are significant benefits that can be attained from aligning IT and business strategies however in terms of value, the value that can be added to the organisations is not substantial.
IT business alignment is usually referred to as the “Holy Grail”.
IT business alignment is not easier said than done in practice.
The crucial factor for successful IT business alignment is the creation of value at each step of the value chain of the organisations' processes.
IT Business alignment can be defined as the dynamic actualisation of organisational goals and objectives.
IT Business alignment can be defined as the operationalisation of the IT strategies according to the organisational objectives.

text: The Week 4 Lecture on 'People and Teams' discussed 'Key roles in Change Management'. Match the roles to the correct descriptions.

fulfilling the role of coach for their direct reports
applying a structured approach and enabling other

fulfilling the role of sponsors of change
applying a structured approach and enabling other

answers.text: Traditional Outsourcing of non core activities - focused on cost reduction
Strategic outsourcing business processes - focused on enhancing capability and improving

text: The Week 3 Guest Lecture on Outsourcing discussed 'IT Services', match the following IT Services to the suitable example(s).

answers.matching: Specialist IT Security team performing pen testing
Signing up with Microsoft for corporate Email services (charged per user/month)
Contracting IBM to build a new payroll system
Hire external designers to build new front-end for the website

matching_list: Hire external designers to build new front-end for the website

Contracting IBM to build a new payroll system
Signing up with Microsoft for corporate Email services (charged per user/month)

text: Based on the 'Week 3 Guest Lecture on Outsourcing' what are the benefits of 'Managed Services' (Select all that are applicable).

answers.answer_text: Easy to scale up or down

text: The reading (Top 6 software development models and how they influence the SDLC) discusses the Agile SDLC model. Which of the following options did the reading discuss as the most popular sub-groups/techniques within Agile? (Select all that are applicable).
According to the reading (Project Success and Failure: Factors that make for Project Success or Failure) what are some of the factors that make a project a success? (Select all that apply).

answers.answer_text: Have backup strategies to deal with possible problems.
Doing more than is required by contract .
Match the right people to the right jobs.
Ensure work pages are the proper size - i.e. manageable in size and realistic in terms of effort and time.

text: Which 3 steps from John Kotter's 8 step change model are focused on "Creating a climate for change"? (Select all that are applicable)
Match the group of people with the role they play in supporting management of change.

answers.matching: Coaching the people who report to them
Integrating the people side of change

matching_list: Coaching the people who report to them
Integrating the people side of change

text: Which of the following are key perspectives of ADKAR. (Select all that apply).

answers.answer_text: Visible and active sponsorship is not only desirable but necessary for success
The “right” answer is not enough to successfully implement change
Change agents must be conscious of both a senders’ mentality and the receivers’ orientation
Employees go through the change process in stages and go through these stages as individuals
Employee resistance is the norm, not the exception. Expect some to never support the change
It is important to try to get everyone to move through change together
Once you convince the early adopters to change, the others will follow
It is important to slow down if change isn't working
Value systems have a direct impact on how employees react to change
The size of the change determines how much and what kind of change management is needed

text: According to the reading (Team Building in Project Management) what are some characteristics of an ineffective project team? (Select all that apply).

answers.answer_text: Professional Objectives of Team Members Coincides with Project Requirements
Team Members Operate Independently/ Lack of Coordination

text: The lecture in Week 4 on 'Finding and Trusting Information' defines sources as?

answers.answer_text: None of these options are correct
The circumstances that form the setting of an event
The materials from which ideas  and information are gathered.

text: Based on the lecture in Week 4 on 'Finding and Trusting Information' what is the purpose of Referencing? (Select all that are applicable)

answers.answer_text: To allow the writer to copy other writer's work
Point the reader to the original documents so that they can determine independently whether the attributed sources support the author’s argument as written
Acknowledge the original source of ideas and work that is not the author's own
For the writer to remember where they got the information from

text:
The lecture in Week 4 on 'Finding and Trusting Information' discusses 'Data', 'Information', 'Knowledge' and 'Wisdom'.

Match the following examples to the term that best describes the example.

answers.matching: Don't put tomato in a fruit salad.

matching_list: Don't put tomato in a fruit salad.

text: According to the reading (5 Stages of a Team Development Tuckman | Better Explained) match the five stages of team development to the description that best describes what occurs in the stage.

answers.matching: This is the stage in which the team members meet for the very first time and are excited, positive and polite towards one another.
This is the stage in which the team's effectiveness drops drastically and where most teams fail. This is where the team members need to discuss skills, background etc.
This is the stage in which team effectiveness should go up exponentially. In this stage team members ask each other for help, provide constructive feedback etc.
This is the stage in which team members find it easy to be a part of the team, you can easily accomodate new people and start to focus on other goals and areas of work.
This is the stage in which the teams are disbanded and most people will need to find new opportunities.

matching_list: This is the stage in which the teams are disbanded and most people will need to find new opportunities.
This is the stage in which team effectiveness should go up exponentially. In this stage team members ask each other for help, provide constructive feedback etc.
This is the stage in which team members find it easy to be a part of the team, you can easily accomodate new people and start to focus on other goals and areas of work.
This is the stage in which the team's effectiveness drops drastically and where most teams fail. This is where the team members need to discuss skills, background etc.
This is the stage in which the team members meet for the very first time and are excited, positive and polite towards one another.

text: According to the reading (Project Success and Failure: Factors that make for Project Success or Failure) (Links to an external site.) what are some major causes of project failure? (Select all that apply).

answers.answer_text: Tie together responsibility, performance and rewards.
Allow adequate time and effort for layouts.
Doing more than is required by contract .

According to the reading (Critical success factors in project management. To fail or not to fail, that is the question!) (Links to an external site.) what are some of the factors that have a small influence on project success?

answers.answer_text: Periodically meeting of the steering commitee.

text: Based on the Week 6 Lecture - Project Estimation, what are the 'Five steps in project estimation'?

answers.answer_text: Determine the SIZE of the project

text: Based on the Week 6 Lecture - Project Estimation, which of the following project estimation approaches are not common? (Select all that are applicable).

answers.answer_text: Used as input to compute cost, duration.
“Embedded” communications processing  software for electronic funds transfer network; software for electronic funds transfer network.
A mathematical function that mimics some trend seen in  observed data.
Cannot be used to predict, but not explain the behaviour of  a system.

text: Base on the reading (The Benefits of business analytics) what are the different types of business analytics? (Select all that are applicable).
Base on the reading (The Benefits of business analytics) what are some of the benefits of using business analytics? (Select all that are applicable).

answers.answer_text: The ability to measure accomplishments against overall goals.

text:
Based on the reading (The Ultimate Guide to Project Tracking) is the following statement true or false?

"Project tracking is a method of project management for following progress (or lack thereof) of activities involved in projects".
Based on the reading (The Ultimate Guide to Project Tracking) what are four key benefits that effective project tracking should deliver? (Select all that are applicable).
"The process by which data is scrambled and encoded to make it unintelligible" is which of the following?
The following statement "A password that works for only one network session or transaction" defines which of the following terms.
The statement " Individuals who work to exploit vulnerabilities in a computer system, sometimes for information gathering, protest or theft" defines which one of the following threats?
Which of the following terms can be defined as "a requirement of more than one method to validate an user"

The “cyber kill chain” is a sequence of stages required for an attacker to successfully infiltrate a network and exfiltrate data from it.

Order the stages of a "cyber kill chain".
Which of the following best defines the security incident "Improper Usage"?

answers.answer_text: An attack that employs brute force methods to compromise, degrade, or destroy systems, networks, or services
Any incident resulting from violation of an organization’s acceptable usage policies by an authorized user.
The loss or theft of a computing device or media used by the organization, such as a laptop or smartphone.
An attack executed via an email message or attachment (e.g. malware infection).

text: Which of the following incident types aligns to the "Exploitation and Installation" Stage of the cyber kill chain? (Select all that are applicable).

Is the following statement true or false?

“When directly quoting from a source you should include the quote in quotation marks and provide in-text references”.
When should you include in-text referencing? (Select all that are applicable).

answers.answer_text: When paraphrasing points from a source
When including direct quotes from a source

text:
Is the following statement true or false?

“Entries in a Reference List should be placed in alphabetical order in APA6th”
You use a direct quote from a source (e.g. Book) in your report. How would you write the in-text citation in APA 6th referencing format?

answers.answer_text: author’s full name, year, page number i.e. (David Lowe, 2022, pp. 10-12)
author’s last name, year, page number i.e. (Lowe, 2022, pp. 10-12)
author’s full name, year i.e. (David Lowe, 2022)
author’s last name, page number i.e. (Lowe, pp. 10-12)
author’s last name, title i.e. (Lowe, “Referencing and Writing”)

text: When you include a quote that is more than 40 words what do you need to do? (Select all that are applicable).

answers.answer_text: Include quotation marks to show the exact words.
Begin quoting the material on a new line and indent it five spaces.
Make sure the quote is exactly as it was published.
Include the author’s details, year of publication (if available) and page numbers.

text: When the publication year is not available what would you include in place of the publication year in your reference?

answers.answer_text: Indicate the source has no date by using the abbreviation n.d. to indicate ‘not dated’ i.e. (Lowe, n.d.).
Nothing i.e. your reference would only include the author’s last name (Lowe).

text: When the author’s details are not available what information should you use in its place when providing a reference?

answers.answer_text: Include the title of the source (or an abbreviated version if the title is long) in place of the author’s name i.e. (“Writing and Referencing”, 2022)
Nothing i.e. your reference would only include the year of publication (2022).

text: When directly quoting if there are no page numbers what should you do?

answers.answer_text: Include paragraph numbers by using the numbers provided or count the paragraph numbers if not visible i.e. (Lowe, 2022, para. 3).
Leave it blank i.e. leave out the page numbers
Option B and C are both correct.
Include a section heading and paragraph number i.e. (Lowe, 2022, Introduction, para. 3).

text:
Is the following statement true or false?

“If I include an in-text reference in the body of my report the reader should be able to match it to a reference in my reference list using the author’s name and year of publication I have provided”.

Is the following statement true or false?

“All the references in my reference list do not need to be only for sources I have used in the body of my report”
When you have multiple sources that have the same author and year of publication what should you do? (Select all that are applicable).

answers.answer_text: Nothing, the reader doesn’t need to be able to distinguish between the references since they are all by the author.
If the author and year of publication are the same, alphabetise the references by the title.
None of these options are correct.
Add a lower case letter after the year of publication i.e. (Lowe, 2022a), (Lowe, 2022b) etc.

text: Which of the following are typical approaches taken to sourcing IT talent? (Select all that apply).
According to the reading (Team Building in Project Management) what are some characteristics of an effective project team? (Select all that apply).

answers.answer_text: High Interest in the Team and Team Processes

text:
According to the reading (The Ultimate Guide to IT Project Management) is the following statement true or false?

"An information technology (IT) project is a type of project that deals with IT infrastructure, information systems or computers."

"The adaptive lifecycle style of Agile Methodologies has the flexibility to condense timelines into shorter activity bursts".

As per the reading (Top 6 software development models and how they influence the SDLC) is the following statement true or false?

The DevOps SDLC model is "built around the principles of collaboration and automation as well as reduce the interaction between technical departments and managers".

The reading (Information Technology and Business Alignment: Why it is Important) discusses 6 critical characteristics that an organisation can do to ensure IT Business Alignment. The first step is "realising and recognising that organisations can use IT as a transformative tool". Is this statement true or false?
As per the reading (Waterfall vs. Incremental vs. Spiral vs. Rad Model: Key Difference) which SDLC model does not allow you to return to an earlier phase when implemented?

The reading (Waterfall vs. Incremental vs. Spiral vs. Rad Model: Key Difference) identifies two SDLC models as not appropriate for handling large projects and need requirements to be defined at the beginning of the project.

Which of the following options correctly identifies these two models? (Select all that are applicable).

According to the reading (Waterfall vs. Incremental vs. Spiral vs. Rad Model: Key Difference) is the following statement true or false? "The incremental SDLC model framework type is a combination of linear and iterative hence its objective is rapid development and promotes maintainability, but only requires user involvement only at the beginning".
When using sources to gather information to use in your work, which of the following things should you DEFINITELY do? (Select all that are applicable)

answers.answer_text: Assess the sources you find using the R.E.V.I.E.W criteria before you use them in your work
Put all the sources you used throughout your work in the reference list
Include in-text references for any ideas that are not your own

text: Based on the Week 8 lecture 'Testing Management' what is the purpose of 'Stress Testing'?

answers.answer_text: Stressing the system to breaking point to determine  whether the breakdown is potentially harmful.
Modelling the expected usage of a software  program by simulating multiple users accessing  the program concurrently.
Exposing problems such as memory leaks or  stack overflows.
None of the options are correct.

text: Based on the Week 8 lecture 'Testing Management' match the definitions and descriptions to the correct test type.

answers.text: To ensure that each component behaves  ‘correctly’.
To ensure that the user requirements  have been met.
To test system performance under maximum expected load.
To ensure that system is stable over extended period.
To test interaction between related components.
Compares system functionality against agreed-on user requirements
Carried out by client using scenarios, supervised by developer
Simulates key processes under maximum load.
Focuses on usual business processes, and normal workflow.
Load increased until system fails. Checks effects of over-load.
Uses white-box testing to check each program function fully.

text: Based on the Week 8 lecture 'Testing Management' what are some problems of testing?

answers.answer_text: Performance testing had not anticipated the level of user load.
The functionality of the system had been tested, but not under load.
Nobody knew that the system would fail completely under pressure.

text: Based on the Week 10 Lecture - Communication, what two things can help make writing clear?
Based on the Week 10 Lecture - Communication, what are the characteristics of professional writing?

answers.answer_text: Any job that you might do
An occupation that is recognised by the government for the purposes of immigration
An occupation that will typically require formal training and a qualification

text: Business value is:

answers.answer_text: Anything that contributes to the overall health and success of an organisation
Anything that contributes to the assets of a company
The specific goodwill felt by stakeholders in an organisation
Anything that increases the share price of an organisation

text: IT workers typically focus on providing supporting infrastructure, and usually aren't responsible for driving change at an organizational level.
Whilst workers across most enterprises are becoming more tech-savvy, workers in the IT department:

answers.answer_text: Shouldn't spend valuable time trying to understand marketing, as this isn't their role.
Should understand the nuances of marketing, as this helps them understand value in the organisation

text: As per the reading is the following statement 'True' or 'False'? “Even though the importance of the communication management knowledge area is highlighted and stressed by most stakeholders, the communication practices and procedures that are part of the organisation’s project management methodology are not given precedence or adhered to by the project managers”.

"IT provides value to an organisation by making everyone's work easier"
